text:
I have a task "ontoc".

if i put the <taskdef> line direct before the <ontoc> task the
XmlLogger does not assign the messages from the ontoc task to the <ontoc> node 
in the xml file.

<taskdef name="ontoc" classname="de.dailab.jiac41.ant.Ontoc"/>  
<ontoc ontologypath="${build.ontojavas}" ontologysourcepath="${source.java}">
</ontoc>


log.xml

<message priority="info"><![CDATA[Was expecting:]]></message>
<message priority="info"><![CDATA[    "(" ...]]></message>
<message priority="info"><![CDATA[    ]]></message>
<task name="ontoc" location="D:\DAI\Projekte\JIAC\core\build.xml:247: "...>
  <message priority="debug"><![CDATA[   +Task: ontoc]]
</task>


Placing the <taskdef> line in the project node (build.xml) the output is fine:

<task name="ontoc" location="D:\DAI\Projekte\JIAC\core\build.xml:247: "...>
  <message priority="info"><![CDATA[Was expecting:]]></message>
  <message priority="info"><![CDATA[    "(" ...]]></message>
  <message priority="info"><![CDATA[    ]]></message>
  <message priority="debug"><![CDATA[   +Task: ontoc]]
</task>

text:
I've been looking into this issue and it involves UnknownElement.  The 
start/finished messages get logged with an UnknownElement task, and the 
messages get logged with the actual task.  Could someone that understands this 
stuff a bit better lend a set of eyes to see if its something easy to fix?  It 
seems it has to do with the perform method in Task and that the events are 
being fired with 'this' which is an UnknownElement at the time.

A related question: why call maybeConfigure after firing the start task event?  
Shouldn't start be fired first?
Fixed in 1.6. Please try the next nightly build.
